page.title: 16EDUCATION
page.content: Primary, Secondary, College. There are no schools in Camber itself; all children have to travel to Rye, the small children by coach and the older ones by public transport. There is some concern about the very young children being away from home for so long, but to maintain the standard this is considered the better option. Schooling is imaginitive and the results from the examinations are good. If children and their parents are keen to obtain the best education, the opportunity is there. In further education the problem of transport does arise, as buses from Camber do not coincide with the train times to Hastings, the nearest town with technical college facilities. There is an open-air swimming pool at the junior school in Rye.
